content.question: Which of the following scales is played?

choices.label: The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The only accidental is F-sharp.
The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The accidentals are F-sharp, G-sharp, and A-sharp.
The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The accidentals are C-sharp, F-sharp, G-sharp, and A-sharp.
The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The accidentals are C-sharp, D-sharp, F-sharp, G-sharp, and A-sharp.

content.answer: The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The accidentals are C-sharp, D-sharp, F-sharp, G-sharp, and A-sharp.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
